Your own dining experience. Diana D.
Delicious Thai food with great flavor! Cozy vibe, friendly staff â€” highly recommend the Pad Cha and steamed fish!

We really enjoyed our meal here! The soft-shell crab was crispy and super tasty, and the curry beef with rotti was our favorite â€” so flavorful and comforting. The beef noodle soup was a hit with our kid too, very fragrant and easy to eat. Thai iced tea is always a must for us and theirs was perfect. Great spot for families â€” weâ€™ll definitely be back!
ONE wor5

Love the ribeye steak and pork joewl

Must try !
The best Authentic Thai food you can get in Little Neck! Come and enjoy with your family and friends! Great service! I will definitely come again!

this place is top notch authentic food

Just go!!

BEST THAI FOOD IN NY!
I've tried so many Thai places in the city and it was always overpriced or small portions or drowning in fish sauce. This place gives really good portions and tastes amazing!! Everything is 5/5! The interior design is also such a cool vibes and so pretty. Definitely gonna come back :)
Great food. Great ambiance. Comfortable seating. If you want Thai get this

This would be my top number one Thai food restaurants in Queens. I love the taste of the Thai food in here. Every dishes are worth to try from appetizer to main dishes and to last dessert. Itâ€™s a really good atmosphere where you can enjoyed spending your lunch/ dinner with your loved ones. Another thing to mention, great services! The waitress was nice and helpful!
The food tastes great with reasonable price, will come back
The food is extremely delicious. The environment is great. The service is excellent. Everything is wonderful. The food is really delicious.
They just lost a regular costumer that always orders online from them. On numerous occasions they miss my institution notes, I always gave them benefit of the doubt, but never again.

I am a vegetarian, and everything was good

I like this Thai restaurant very much. Their lunch is very rich, the dishes are also very rich, the seafood is very fresh, and the environment is also very elegant. I will come here often in the future.
Excellent date night spot for during the week. The staff very knowledgeable and they have a selection.

This was a serendipitous find.  After an unexpectedly bad reception at La Baraka that we walked out of; we decided to look around in the area. There were quite a few but when we saw a Thai restaurant we both agreed to give it a shot.

We decided to give their lunch specials a try. Do not hesitate to do this, you will be more than pleasantly surprised.  We agreed on the 'spicy option'.  Delish delish delish!  Everything we had surprised us.  What a find!!
Super tasty Thai food with a cool modern twist. Feels like home cooking. Definitely worth a try!
Love it! Thai food~
One of the best Thai restaurants I've ever experienced. All the servers are very friendly and the food is delicious. I especially recommend tuna salad and fried ice cream desserts!!

The most beautiful and delicious Thai restaurants in Little Neck are here for you, The decoration and presentation of the dishes will make you feel like you are in Thailand every minute! This Thai cuisine is sour and spicy, not sweet.
Steam fish ğŸ  with spicy lime juice was sour and spicy, super appetizing, I love this dish more in summer, tender smooth and delicious.
Tom Yum Seafood Hotpot: warms your body in any season! Spicy ğŸŒ¶ï¸ and sour taste, perfect combination of prawns and mushrooms and onions.
Papaya salad: this a must-order, donâ€™t miss it if you like it
Pineapple fried rice: Very suitable for children who eat a lot.
Mango sticky rice: My princess' favorite dessert, fresh mango and rice are salty and sweet, very delicious, not at all sweet, the taste is absolutely amazing!
Thai tea: Delicious, a little sweet.
Food is great and staff helpful, crab curry not standard size but charge 3% credit card surcharge without notice.

The green curry with tofu was soo good . Food was fresh, seasoned to perfection, and presentation was on point.

Looking forward to my next visitğŸ˜
The best Thai food I have had in Queens, but the portion is really small.
Awesome food and nice restaurant.
Small cozy place. Friendly staff. We all liked the food here.

Thai restaurant with relaxing atmosphere and delcious food. We totally enjoyed everything we ordered, appetizer, main, and desert. Staff are very friendly and patient, and the food came out hot and on time.
On average, we spent about $75/person.  If you pay with cc, there is a 3% surcharge.
No words. Everything was 10/10, you have to get the mango ice cream itâ€™s like ascending into heavenğŸ™â€¦
å¥½å¥½åƒå¾—æ³°é¤

Amazing tasty food, good portion sizes, great customer service, price points medium, family friendly, difficulty finding parking. I had beef larb salad and pina colada, very nice. Will definitely recommend as a date spot, or family gathering.
I always order from Uber Eats and it never disappoints. They package everything so well especially their drinks. 10/10 my go to thai place!
Food and services is exceptional it different from other Thai restaurants around there I like Thai food Thai food here very delicious and they are open 7 day a week now !!
A rare find in NY!  Food is excellent.  Staff are friendly.  I'll be back very soon!
This place was so good. The food here is  just on a whole other level and wish we had this back in Maryland. Without a doubt one of the best restaurants in the area

Overall good food, they had a huge selection of different dishes and the portions were so large that I couldnâ€™t finish. The interior is a really nice design and detailing, and the food is overall very affordable.
Beautifully decorated, gorgeous dinnerware that makes the food taste even better and outrageous  presentation. The food was fantastic and service spot on.

I went to this Thai restaurant in Little Neck to celebrate passing my U.S. driverâ€™s license test! The drinks were too sweet, but the crispy fried pork was pretty goodâ€”especially with their sweet and sour dipping sauce, which was really tasty! The curry crab was decent, the sticky rice was just okay, and the sweet and sour mango fried fish was impressive if youâ€™re capable of handling the spicy tasteã€‚As for the $10 mango ice cream, it was just so so.

This is my new favorite Thai restaurant! Everything we ordered tasted just like authentic food straight from Thailand. I loved it so much, I came back twice in one week. Amazing flavors all around. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back again!

First time coming here by a coworker's recommendation. Love the food, friendly staff and nice decor. Got there around lunch time and got seated right away. Food came out quick. Love the tom yum Kong soup, very rich in flavors. The mango sticky rice is also so good. Sampler of the appetizers was a perfect choice - you get to try in a deal. Must try this place if you are in the hood and love Thai cuisine, will definitely come back to try the other stuff.

(5/5 â­ï¸) everything we ordered was soooo good ! We got the shrimp dumplings, chicken wings, spring rolls. The spring rolls were soooooo delicious. The chicken wings were crispy and good and the sauces were sooo good. The pad see ew with shrimp was so good. The drunken noodles were spicy but not too much. Everything was so good. The service was friendly and attentive. Thad the lychee sangria and old fashion. Both good. The old fashion had a Smokey taste and it was sweet and good.

My second time to dine here. Last time I came for dinner which I was very happy with the lamb chops...
Today we came to try the lunch special.
I chose duck meat with curry... Which is just a little spicy and rich in favor. Meat was tender. And the side salad included in the special was fresh leafy, onion, cucumber, shredded carrots, cherry tomato, two pieces tofu. Huge potion ğŸ˜™
I paid $18 for that.

My son ordered pad Thai and we shared the papaya salad which was fresh too.

This restaurant is small but not too crowded today at 2pm for late lunch â˜ºï¸

Please note that you do have to pay extra 3% if use credit card to pay
It was as close to the original taste and delicious as what I was eating in Bangkok. The price is reasonable and friendly. The food is a little bit sweet, but it's acceptable and okay.

Amazing food and wonderful service! I have been eating here regularly for a couple of years now and their food has always been consistently good. I mostly opt for delivery but do dine in on special occasions. The ambiance is cozy and warm and the staff is very attentive. I've tried many items on their menu and there hasn't been a single item that disappoints. Flavors and textures are always well-balanced and perfectly spiced and their plating is impeccable! I don't eat meat and their menu has a good variety of vegetarian and seafood dishes. My personal favorites are Tom Yum soup, Drunken noodles with veggies, Green curry with tofu and jasmine rice, and mango sticky rice for dessert. My only complaint is their appetizer portions are a bit small and their menu is a little on the pricier side, however, the entrees are well portioned, the food is always fresh, and they don't skimp on ingredients so it's definitely worth the price. Highly recommend for dine-in or take-out!!

Bangkok Ave is top-notch service, and the atmosphere is impeccable. The prices are very reasonable, drinks too. The duck was excellent, but the massaman was ok. There are plenty of seafood, chicken, and pork options. Bathrooms were clean and nongendered. The plating and presentation are really nice here to enjoy family style. Would recommend it if, in the area.

Likely the best Thai restaurant in Northeast Queens! Phenomenal dishes - especially pad Thai and tamarind duck. Also the Thai Fried Rice, along with chicken satay, curry puffs, you name it, all fantastic. Homemade coconut ice cream with coconut sweet sticky rice is ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»ğŸ‘ŒğŸ»

Walked in and seated right away on a Sunday around 5:30pm. The host was gracious and welcoming. Menus and water right away. The four of us ordered the fried tofu, Mock fish with baby bokchoy, Musamum curry with beef and roti, Pad thai and the fried pork hock.
Everything was delicious. The sauces that came with the pork shoulder was beyond (wanting to buy some to bring home). Pad thai was good maybe a tad sweet for my taste. The Mock fish is quite fishy (unexpectedly) but textured like salmon...very interesting. The fried tofu was delish with the sauce. I like the texture of it
Overall we enjoyed the meal.
The food was delicious, and our waitress was very polite and accommodating. The pad thai is as authentic as it gets. The mango sticky rice is a must try it. We'll definitely be coming back!

We tried tom yum soup, thai sausage, yellow crab curry and drunken noodle.
everything was good but crab curry wasnt the best one i've ever had. However, the portion of the crab was generous!
I like the interior of the restaurant and staffs were nice.

Thank you for the great service Bangkok Avenue!  It was a special farewell dinner for family members that we havent seen for decade+, and flying out that night.  Food, service and atmosphere were all wonderful.  Our wait staff, she was very informative and attentive to our ordering and needs.  Mango fish was delicious and so was everything else we ordered. The 4 specials on the menu was ğŸ‘ğŸ‘, esp the boiled pork bone dish.   Coming back with my friends next time.

This charming restaurant will transports you straight to Thailand with its beautiful decor and cozy ambiance âœ¨

The seating area is designed to look like a boat, with stunning wall art of a river behind it, making you feel like youâ€™re dining on water. The creative and fun drinks are just the beginning of an unforgettable dining experience.

We were blown away by the amazing flavors of the Tom Yum Ramen Nam Khom and the Spicy Herbal Fish. Each bite was a burst of deliciousness! ğŸ¤¤ğŸ”¥ The Crab Roll appetizer was packed with so much crab, it was simply divine. And for dessert lovers, donâ€™t miss out on the Fried Banana â€“ itâ€™s the perfect sweet ending to a perfect meal.

The warm and welcoming hospitality made our visit even more special. We canâ€™t wait to go back

Featuring â¤µï¸
Crab roll
Papaya salad with shrimp
Chu chu duck
Spicy herbal fish
Tom yum ramen Nam Khon
Old Bangkok
Very Berry
Pina Colada

Follow @spinx17 for more NYC food spots

In search of a go-to Thai Spot & after many attempts - I believe we've found the place.

Atmosphere: The vibes are on point. Beautiful decor, Art, furniture, and seating. The bar is well lit. Comfy chairs & liquors on display. It's very social media friendly. The server / host was very welcoming. It was a Wednesday night and wasn't packed. So, we had our choice of seating.

Drinks: We ordered two thai iced teas - Yummy. Not overly sweet. Nice and cold. There was a Thai Iced Tea Float but unfortunately it wasn't available to try. I'll be going back for this.

There is a vast selection of well know classic Thai dishes and some not so know (at least to me) but they all look delicious.

Appetizers: We ordered the shrimp cake. It was tasty with the plum sauce and on it's own a 5/10 with the sauce 8.5/10

Entrees: I ordered the Beef Stew & my wife got the minced pork fried rice.

Beef Stew with vermicelli noodles was fantastic. It was aromatic, fresh, and visually appealing. The spices reminded me of a dish called Pepper pot. The beef was tender and flavorful. The beef balls were tender and juicy. I loved the pepper infused broth. I would enjoy this on a cold winter day.

Minced Pork Fried Rice: Perfectly seasoned. A nice spicy kick. Pork was nice and not fatty. Well balanced flavors. The runny egg on the rice was *chefs kiss.*
My wife really enjoyed it.

Portions are good. If you're hungry you'll be satisfied.

Parking in this neighborhood is decent but gets busy in the afternoon.

I can't wait to go back & try their Crab Omelette

We have been coming to this restaurant regularly for about 3 years. The decor and the ambience are lovely. We are always greeted by friendly staff and the service is attentive. On top of the beautiful plating, the food is flavorful and delicious.
During today's visit, we witnessed the waitress TAR being treated by rude customers. She handled it professionally and courteously. TAR is always so sweet and friendly. We will keep coming back to this restaurant for great service and delicious food (love their chicken wings, noodle soups, crabmeat omelets and Tom Yum Ramen hot pot!). Oh, and the weekend happy hour drinks are a nice touch!

I have been to Bangkok so many times for 8-10 years, I am almost a local. This restaurant definitely serves authentic thai food with beautiful presentation. I knew I got the right place once I asked for the Thai Boat Noodle condiments (the thai chilli powder, vinegar, etc). I came here for lunch alone, ordered the soup and beef boat noodle. Great service, great food. Happy belly.

Love this place. I tend to order in alot but recently the delivery apps have been taking too long. decided to go in person and the food was so good. the drunken noodles are perfectly chewy and the sauce is delicious. the som tum (papaya salad) is one of my favorites! it comes with pork rinds, so i recommend asking them to take it off if you donâ€™t like it. i personally didnâ€™t finish the spring rolls, you can tell that theyâ€™re well made and theyâ€™re super crispy, but thereâ€™s not much filling.

Bangkok Avenue is such a great place for Thai food. Amazing food, pretty authentic, great flavors, and kind staff! The portion sizing is big too. My favorite part is the restaurant itself, so well decorated and so cozy. Love the indoor and outdoor seating. Highly recommend to anyone looking for Thai food in Queens!
